description:
Creates an integration event.

Events are used for sending certain notifications whenever an action is performed on OpsRamp entities.

###### Notes

- Provide API payload in Base64 encoding.
- Integration event for Alert entity is created only using API but can be viewed from the OpsRamp Portal.

Create Event with Alert Entity Type to create an event with alert entity type for work flow events only.

entity.description:
Entity on which an action is performed. Supported entities include:
Service Desk
INCIDENT
SERVICEREQUEST
CHANGE
PROBLEM
TASK
Resource
Alert
ALERT (used only when eventType is selected as NONE)

eventType.description:
Type of action performed on the entity. Supported values include:
NONE (Used to invoke external integration through process workflow), CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE

notifier.title: notifier
notifier.description: The fields are required unless specific to an `authType`.

userName.description: Username: Mandatory when authType is OAUTH2 and grantType is PASSWORD/REFRESH_TOKEN.

password.description: Password: Mandatory when authType is OAUTH2 and grantType is PASSWORD/REFRESH_TOKEN.

apiKey.description: API Key: Mandatory if authType is OAUTH2.

apiSecret.description: API Secret: Mandatory if authType is OAUTH2.

accessTokenURL.description: Access Token URL: Mandatory if authType is OAUTH2.

tokenHeaders.description: (JWT only) Headers to request the token.

tokensPath.description: (JWT only) Token path in the response of the authentication REST call.

resourceAuthHeaders.description: (JWT only) Authorization header for resource calls.

thirdPartyEventType.description: Type of action performed on the entity.Supported Values: POST, PUT, GET, DELETE, and PATCH

payload.description:
(Optional) Third-party integration event payload. Provide the third-party payload with OpsRamp placeholders to integrate the event between OpsRamp and third-party:
- To get OpsRamp tokens, use refer to the Get Integration Event Placeholders API.
- Convert the payload to base 64 and provide the file in the field file in the below sample request.

filterCriteria.title: filterCritera
filterCriteria.description: (Optional) Filter entities on which the event is added to the rules:

matchType.description: Match All or Any of the rules.

filterType.description:
Filtered resource type.
- AWS example: AUTO_SCALING, CLOUDFRONT, DYNAMO_DB, ANY_DEVICE, ELASTICACHE, ELASTICMAPREDUCE, KINESIS, LAMBDA, LOAD_BALANCER, MACHINE_LEARNING, RDS, REDSHIFT.
- Azure example: EBS, WEBSITE, SQL_SERVER, SQL_DATABASE, RESOURCE_GROUP, REDIS_CACHE, DOCUMENT_DB.
- Google example: ANY_CLOUD_RESOURCE, ANY_DEVICE, EBS, GCE_CLUSTER, SQL_SERVER, SQL_DATABASE, GCE_TOPIC, GCE_SUBSCRIPTION, GCE_ROUTER, VPN.

key.description: Unique attribute name to filter the resource type. Example: Name, Region Name, Zone Name, Name, Subject, Description.

operator.description: Operating values to filter the resource type. Example: Contains, Not Contains, Equals, Not Equals, Starts with, Ends with, Regex, Is.

useBaseNotifier.description:
(Optional) Notification details to trigger events defined. To configure integration base notifier:
- Provide useBaseNotifier: true to assign the notifier details to the event.
- Provide useBaseNotifier: false to assign different notifier details
